DOC.detailed_description: The overarch goal study advance research family-based prevention negative child outcome reintegrate Operation Enduring Freedom/Operation Iraqi Freedom personnel evaluate different format parent program , After Deployment , Adaptive Parenting Tools ( ADAPT ) . The ADAPT program base upon Parent Management Training-Oregon Model/PMTO , adapt military deployed family . The investigator examine three delivery format ADAPT effective reduce youth risk behavior associate negative childhood outcome improve parenting , child , parent adjustment . There clear intent benefit subject study ( except survey teacher ) , include child . Combat deployment relate challenge family stressor , associate negative parent-child interaction , ineffective coercive parenting practice low level parent satisfaction . Disrupted parenting practice well-known predictor risk child adjustment difficulty precursor youth substance use , include behavior problem , school failure , deviant peer association , depression . These child adjustment problem contribute continue parental stress , increase parental distress , disrupt parenting .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : one parent return deployment OIF OEF least one child age 512 custody living parent ( ) home high speed internet access home We include singleand twoparent family , well family care share nonpartnered adult ( e.g . grandparent mother ) active psychosis open child protection case abuse neglect family serious child mental health diagnosis family pilot material participate currently participate original ADAPT RCT .
